}}</ref> In a 2011 letter to Attorney General Eric Holder and the Drug Enforcement Administration, Senators [[Charles Schumer]] of New York and [[Joe Manchin]] of West Virginia called for an investigation into Bitcoin and Silk Road.<ref name="npr-06-12-11"/> Schumer described the use of Bitcoins at Silk Road as a form of [[money laundering]].<ref name="ars-06-08-11"/> Consequently Britcoin, the UK exchange, put out a statement calling for regulation of Bitcoin exchanges by law enforcement.<ref name="britcoin reuters" /><ref name="britcoin statement" /> The hacking organization '[[LulzSec]]' accepted donations in Bitcoin, having said that the group "needs bitcoin donations to continue their hacking efforts".<ref name="CNET News"/><ref>{{cite web|last=Olson |first=Parmy |url=http://blogs.forbes.com/parmyolson/2011/06/06/lulzsec-hackers-posts-sony-dev-source-code-get-7k-donation/ |title=LulzSec Hackers Post Sony Dev. }}</ref> In a 2011 letter to Attorney General Eric Holder and the Drug Enforcement Administration, Senators [[Charles Schumer]] of New York and [[Joe Manchin]] of West Virginia called for an investigation into Bitcoin and Silk Road.<ref name="npr-06-12-11"/> Schumer described the use of Bitcoins at Silk Road as a form of [[money laundering]].<ref name="ars-06-08-11"/> Consequently Britcoin, the UK exchange, put out a statement calling for regulation of Bitcoin exchanges by law enforcement.<ref name="britcoin reuters" /><ref name="britcoin statement" /> The hacking organization '[[LulzSec]]' accepted donations in Bitcoin, having said that the group "needs bitcoin donations to continue their hacking efforts".<ref name="CNET News"/><ref>{{cite web|last=Olson |first=Parmy |url=http://blogs.forbes.com/parmyolson/2011/06/06/lulzsec-hackers-posts-sony-dev-source-code-get-7k-donation/ |title=LulzSec Hackers Post Sony Dev. Source Code, Get $7K Donation - Parmy Olson - Disruptors - Forbes |publisher=Blogs.forbes.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref>
  +   +
===Covert "mining"===
  +
In June, 2011, [[Symantec]] warned about the possibility of [[botnet]]s engaging in covert "mining" of bitcoins (unauthorized use of resources of compromised computers to generate bitcoins).<ref>http://www.symantec.com/connect/blogs/bitcoin-botnet-mining</ref>. Later that month, and employee of ABC was caught after using the company's servers to generate bitcoins.<ref>http://thenextweb.com/au/2011/06/23/abc-employee-caught-mining-for-bitcoins-on-company-servers/</ref>
